headline: Nvidia may skip new GPU release in stunning break
summary: In a stunning blow for gamers, it seems that for the first time in decades, Nvidia (NVDA) might look to skip launching a fresh gaming GPU this year. The tech behemoth is looking to forgo a 2026 gaming release due to the ongoing memory supply crunch, according to The Information. Unsurprisingly, ...

headline: Micron Is on an Epic Run. Don’t Fear the Memory-Chip Cycle.
summary: Micron Technology  has been on a stellar run amid a shortage of memory chips but the question is whether it will last.  Micron shares were down 0.2% at $381.96 in early trading.  The stock has more than quadrupled in the past 12 months as demand for memory chips for artificial-intelligence hardware has driven prices up across its products.

headline: Micron stock dips as analyst slashes Nvidia HBM4 supply forecast to zero

headline: Faraday Future to Participate in the Wolfe Research Auto, Auto Tech and Semiconductor Conference in New York on February 11, 2026
summary: LOS ANGELES, February 06, 2026--Faraday Future Intelligent Electric Inc. (NASDAQ: FFAI) ("Faraday Future", "FF" or "Company"), a California-based global shared intelligent electric mobility ecosystem company, announced today that its Global President, Jerry Wang, will participate in the Wolfe Research Auto, Auto Tech and Semiconductor Conference, taking place Wednesday, February 11, 2026, in New York City.

headline: AI Chips Today - AGMH Advances AI Infrastructure With Strategic Chip Procurement
summary: AGMH Group Holdings Inc. has initiated a strategic procurement program aimed at enhancing its capabilities in the AI chip sector. By partnering with leading global semiconductor suppliers, AGMH is focusing on securing high-performance NAND Flash memory and controller chips to support its development of all-flash storage systems tailored for AI workloads. This initiative seeks to address the storage bottlenecks faced by data centers handling large-scale AI applications, which traditional...

headline: Micron’s Singapore Fab Builds AI Memory Capacity While Valuation Stays Stretched
summary: Micron Technology (NasdaqGS:MU) has started construction on a new advanced wafer fabrication facility in Singapore. The multi billion dollar project is planned over roughly a decade to expand NAND and high bandwidth memory manufacturing for AI and data centric uses. The site is expected to co locate R&D, use smart manufacturing systems, create new jobs, and include sustainability measures. For you as an investor, this move highlights how Micron is positioning around memory demand tied to AI...
